content: under the horizontal strand running between the last st worked on the right needle and the first st on the left needle lifting that strand onto the left needle knit the strand through the back loop to create a new stitch note this increase is preferrable however if using it would prevent you from knitting the knockers please use your go to increase as long as it doesn t create a hole kfb knit in the front and back is a good alternative ©2022 tempe yarn and fiber revised 7-19-22 www knittedknockersusa org please share this pattern with anyone wishing to make knockers knitted knocker one-piece by knittedknockersusa org directions front co 6 sts onto one dpn don t turn your work instead slide the 6 stitches to the other end of the needle and begin knitting as if you were creating an i-cord knit two stitches onto each of the other 3 dpns you are now ready to begin knitting in the round next round k to last st on needle m1l k1 around 3 sts increased repeat this round 19 21 23 25 27 31 more times 66 72 78 84 90 102 sts total 22 24 26 28 30 34 sts on each needle next two rounds knit around no increases next round purl this round next round this round we are creating a hole for stuffing and unstuffing the knocker as well as decreasing at the end of each needle needle 1 knit 5 stitches kfb in the next stitch k1 then lift the second stitch from the tip of the right needle the made stitch from the kfb over the knit stitch to bind it off bind off 4 more sts 5 total sts bound off knit to the last 2 sts on needle k2tog needle 2 and needle 3 k to last 2 sts on needle k2tog back next round needle 1 knit 5 sts kfb in the next stitch then using an e-wrap or knitted cast on co 3 sts then knit to the last 2 sts on needle k2tog needle 2 and needle 3 k to last 2 sts on needle k2tog after completing this round there should be 20 22 24 26 28 32 sts on each needle next round k to last 2 sts on needle k2tog around 3 sts decreased continue decreasing in this manner but in addition every 10th round also work a k2tog at the beginning of each needle continue decreasing until 6 sts remain cut yarn leaving a 6-8 tail using a darning/tapestry needle thread the yarn through the remaining stitches and pull tight knot the tail to secure it then use the darning needle to bring the tail to the inside of the knocker leaving it uncut inside the knocker finishing if you are mailing your knocker s to our organization please leave your yarn tails as-is after threading the final one through those last stitches knotting and pulling it to the inside please send
